intro: Harnieria kempeana subsp. rhadinophylla, commonly known as the Kew's harnieria, is a rare and distinctive member of the Ericaceae family. It is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form with dense, leathery foliage. The leaves are typically dark green and glossy, with a slightly waxy texture. This subspecies is native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes in South America. It produces small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of pink and white, which bloom in the spring and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
